task:
Which of the following ordered pairs $(x, y)$ is a solution to the system of inequalities?
$$
y ≤ -2x + -6
$$
$$
y ≤ 0x + 10
$$
explanation: The solutions to the system of inequalities are all ordered pairs $(x, y)$ that satisfy both inequalities. A correct solution satisfies both y ≤ -2x + -6 and y ≤ 0x + 10, making (-5, 1) the correct choice.
